body.name: Dash Cam, 2K+UHD Dash Camera for Cars, ADDPET Car Camera, Free 64GB Card, Dash Cam Front with WDR, 170° Wide Angle Dashcam, 24H Parking Monitor Car Dash Cam, G-Sensor, Loop Recording
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22. Order within 1 hr 31 mins
features: 【2K UHD & 170° Wide-Angle FOV】The ADDPET Dash Cam K13, equipped with a 2K camera, records in 2304 x 1296P HD high resolution—nearly 1.5 times clearer than a standard 1080P dashcam. It effortlessly captures license plates, road signs, and crucial details with its 170° wide-angle FOV, enabling the monitoring of more lanes with fewer blind spots.

【Compact and Super Easy to Install】 The unique compact design of this dash camera ensures it doesn't block your view or distract you while driving. The front camera angle is adjustable to fit your window. Combined with WDR technology for exposure balance, the ADDPET car camera delivers extremely clear and smooth image quality even in low-light conditions. The included free 64GB card ensures ample daily file storage for your dash camera.

【Loop Recording & Evidence Protection】 The dash camera automatically overwrites the oldest videos with the latest ones. Video evidence is securely stored on a microSD memory card, ensuring continuous recording without the risk of crucial footage being overwritten.

【Parking Monitoring & Built-in G-Sensor】 The car camera, equipped with a built-in G-sensor, detects sudden shakes or collisions around the vehicle even in your absence. The ADDPET car dash cam offers a reliable 24-hour parking monitor, automatically initiating recording and capturing potential incidents around your vehicle. (Kind Reminder: The Hardwire Kit is required for parking surveillance mode and is sold separately.)

【WiFi-App Control & Share】 The dashcam features built-in WiFi for effortless app connection. This advanced dash cam allows you to watch live footage and play recorded videos with a simple tap on the app. You can also share footage on social media with just one click. The installation is easy, with detailed instructions provided, making it worry-free even for first-time users.

【WORRY-FREE WARRANTY】 We have a dedicated pre-sales and after-sales team. Feel free to contact us with any questions about this car dash cam, and we'll address all your inquiries and concerns. Our team offers 24/7 technical support.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Your Reliable Partner On the Road 1. Ensure that both the front and rear cameras are securely connected before powering on the screen. Please be sure to remove the clear sticker from the cameras. 2. Utilize the original accessories provided in the package to avoid any compatibility issues when using other accessories. 3. This dash cam supports a maximum of 128GB SD card (64GB TF card is included in the package). 4. Regularly format the micro SD card. If locked videos consume a significant amount of capacity, be sure to release them. 5. When utilizing the 24H parking monitor function, select the time-lapse recording mode and use the dedicated hardwire kit. Failure to do so may result in the car recorder quickly draining your car's battery. 6. For trucks or caravans, a longer cable of 33ft/10m is necessary.

2K+UHD ADDPET Record the road and license plates in clear 2K+UHD video, offering excellent image quality for detailed playback and the ultimate visual experience. Loop Recording In loop recording, the dash cam captures video in 1/3/5 minute segments. When the Micro SD card is full, loop recording automatically overwrites the earliest files, excluding locked videos. Emergency Lock ADDPET car dash camera with adjustable G-Sensor and advanced lenses swiftly captures emergencies, automatically locks and saves footage in the emergency folder to prevent overwriting.

APP Control Built-in WiFi for easy video access via the App (available on IOS/Android), offering a convenient way to view, download, and share footage. Reviewing the product guides before use will greatly assist in setup. Parking Monitor Parking surveillance mode automatically records protected video upon collision detection. For 24-hour parking recording, use the voltage drop cable with a hardwire kit to power the car recorder in normal mode. (Hardwire kit required) 170° Wide Angle Through the combination of WDR technology and 170-degree wide Angle, the full field of view can be recorded better, reducing blind spots, capturing more details, and preserving the real scene both day and night.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Does what it says on the tin
reviews.reviewText: If you're looking for a very basic dashcam, this one will do the trick. It comes with an SD card and all the mounting equipment you need to get started. The included power adapter sports a very long cable, good for the long run around the windshield to hide the cable. It doesn't have an always on internet connection which is good in my opinion, you need to get the footage off manually. While the sensor is very small it does take a reasonable quality video. H265 encoding is included which should extend the life of your SD card and enable more recording, most computers support this format now.Likes- Easy installation and operation- No need for the app unless you want to change a setting (defaults are 2K @ H.264)- Included car adapter has a USB Type-A port- Confidence monitor on the back of the unit lets you in on vital stats and operation- Lightweight, which is good in case of an accidentImprovements- A 12v accessory passthrough would be more welcome than a USB Type A port- App is required to change settings and is not on the app store, so there's a security risk involved- Confidence screen in the rear is very small limiting the usefulness of the information displayed- Single button operation is very limitedOverall for the cost at the time of writing ($56 + 25% coupon) it's a great way to get into dash cams. You'll get everything you need to get started and gain some valuable experience with dashcam technology without breaking the bank.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Software and manual could be much better but it works
reviews.reviewText: Well packaged 2K dashcam with few features or options for mounting. There are two options for software, Waycam which is a QR code listed in the instruction manual was difficult to install and was flakey working. The camera itself had a QR code to install GoLook which looked like a different version of Waycam but worked much better and was more stable. You must use a WiFi connection to your phone to get video’s off the camera, or you can remove the 64gb mem card from the camera to remove video’s manually with a card reader on your PC. Video clarity was good using the 2K setting. The only mounting option was 3M two sided tape, so permanent, but the only power option provided was a cigarette lighter plug which I deem as temporary. They should have included a suction cup mount for temporary installations or a long USB-C hardwire cord for permanent installs. As an emergency video recorder this is OK but there is no way to add a rear camera to the system. The manual, as with most electronics that comes from China is almost useless except for an extensive troubleshooting questions/answers guide, apparently there are lots of things that can and will go wrong. Still, for $57 it’s OK if it lasts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A good basic dashcam
reviews.reviewText: If all you want is to record video while the car is moving, this will do the job. Not many extra features but it has what you need. There is a small screen on it so you can see any error messages and that it's recording. The screen cannot be used for playback. I kept getting an SD card error (64gb card is included) so I put in my laptop and repaired it. The error went away. We will see if the error comes back. To play back video you can remove the SD card and put it in a computer or use the GoLook App in the play store. Do not use the App that is referenced in the manual as that takes you to a Chinese web site where they want you to side load a different App. I would not do that! The GoLook app connects to the camera via a private access point in the camera. A bit awkward, but once you connect you can view saved videos and change some settings. I did not see any settings that needed changing. Some of the settings just display a blank dialog. App appears unfinished and has poor English. I probably will not use it. Good value for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The Good:- The camera quality is good. There is a good field of view and decent framerate. It captures video and details well at night. When the car is stopped, I'm able to see the license plate of the car in front of me (day or night).- It's small, so it doesn't take up too much windshield space- It can work with a standard USB C cable and car charger that I normally use to charge my phone- Comes with 10 ft long charging cable and 64GB microSD cardThe Bad:- The screen CAN NOT be turned off or dimmed. Luckily it's small, but it can be distracting while driving.- There's a constant blinking LED to tell you it's recording, which I don't know why it's necessary since the screen has a recording status on there already. Again distracting.- There's only one method of install, by using the sticky tape on your windshield and it can not be tilted up or down. But I think it'll work for most people (behind or just below their rear view mirror).- Changing settings can only be done through the phone app- The app (WayCam) isn't available on the Google Play Store. Have to download from some Chinese site that I wasn't able to install on my phone due security settings I need for my work. I instead installed the app on an old unused phone. There isn't much on the app other than to download the files from the camera to your phone and a few settings. If you are just using the default settings (which I am), I would just manually take the SD card out and download the files to my computer if there was actually an event I needed to save...and I would skip the app altogether.- There is no ability to mute the mic or pause the recordingOverall, it's a low profile basic dashcam with a tiny screen that stays on all the time and nothing else.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Decent dash cam for a lower price
reviews.reviewText: In general, the dash cam performs admirably in fulfilling its purpose. If you invest some time in going through the provided manual booklet (which only takes about 5-10 minutes to read), or at the very least, give it a quick skim, setting up and using the product becomes a breeze. The features and quality at this price point are unbeatable. So far, I'm very pleased with this product.
